intro: Kyllinga macrantha, commonly known as the broad-leaved spikerush, is a herbaceous plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, which includes sedges and related plants. The plant features grass-like leaves and produces small, clustered spikes of pale green to reddish flowers. Kyllinga macrantha typically grows in wetland habitats such as marshes and swamps. Its morphology and growth habits make it an important component of aquatic and semi-aquatic ecosystems.
